intro: Neokochia californica, commonly known as the California kochia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bract-based flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to red. Neokochia californica is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
